channel.title: International: Top News And Analysis
channel.description: CNBC International is the world leader for news on business, technology, China, trade, oil prices, the Middle East and markets.

item.title: China reports second-quarter GDP growth of 4.7%, missing expectations
item.description: The National Bureau of Statistics did not hold a press conference for the data release. China's high-level policy meeting, the Third Plenum, kicks off Monday.

item.title: China's beer market, the world's largest, set for bounce as drinkers go high-end
item.description: CGS International expects a recovery in beer consumption in the latter part of the year following a likely decline in volumes in the first half compared to 2023.

item.title: World leaders condemn assassination attempt on Trump: 'Tragedy for democracy'
item.description: World leaders have joined together to condemn the assassination attempt on former U.S. President Donald Trump at a Pennsylvania rally over the weekend.

item.title: Asia markets mostly slip as investors assess China GDP miss and assassination attempt on Trump
item.description: China's economy grew 4.7% in the second quarter, missing expectations of a 5.1% expansion forecast by Reuters and lower than the 5.3% seen in the first quarter.

item.title: China gears up for its Third Plenum meeting. Here's why real estate isn't likely the main focus
item.description: China's real estate problems may be massive, but analysts expect the upcoming Third Plenum to focus on other areas — such as high local government debt levels.

item.title: Google reportedly in advanced talks to acquire cyber startup Wiz for $23 billion, its largest-ever deal
item.description: Google is in advanced talks to acquire cybersecurity firm Wiz for $23 billion, The Wall Street Journal reported Sunday.

item.title: Here are the world’s top 15 airports — for on-time flights
item.description: Some 86% of flights from major airports in Cape Town, Brasilia and Panama City are on time, according to a new report by AirHelp.

item.title: CNBC Daily Open: Trump assassination attempt
item.description: The attempted assassination of former President Donald Trump on Saturday left one attendee and the gunman dead, and two more attendees in critical condition.

item.title: Top Wall Street analysts are pounding the table on these 3 dividend stocks
item.description: TipRanks' analyst ranking service pinpoints Wall Street's best-performing stocks, including Walmart and JPMorgan Chase.

item.title: Elon Musk endorses Donald Trump shortly after ex-president injured by shots fired at rally
item.description: Tesla CEO Elon Musk said he “fully” endorses Trump after the former president was injured when shots were fired at a rally in Pennsylvania.

item.title: Olympic gold medalist spends $1,000/month on food: 'It's a pretty significant investment in my athletic performance'
item.description: Shot put star Ryan Crouser has taken home the gold at the past two Olympics and is looking to once again win at Paris 2024.

item.title: JPMorgan's Jamie Dimon warns inflation and interest rates may stay higher
item.description: JPMorgan Chase CEO Jamie Dimon on Friday issued another warning about inflation despite recent signs of easing in price pressures.

item.title: Travelers say these are the best—and worst—U.S. airports for on-time flights, cleanliness, restaurants and more
item.description: AirHelp scored the airports based on flights taken from May 1, 2023 to April 30, 2024.

item.title: The Ambani wedding is costing millions — here's how to have a big impact on a much smaller budget
item.description: Anant Ambani and Radhika Merchant's wedding cost millions, but wedding planners say you can have a glamorous wedding on a much smaller budget.

item.title: Activist Cevian has a stake in medical device company Smith & Nephew. How it may help improve margins
item.description: British company Smith & Nephew is already a global leader in medical tech. Cevian could help it boost its profitability.

item.title: Ron Insana: Look to the U.S. for economic resilience and continued global stock market leadership
item.description: Americans have a homeward bias when it comes to investing — and rightfully so, especially in a year like this.

item.title: 30-year-old left the U.S., relocated to Budapest, and pays $560/month for a 1-bedroom apartment
item.description: Denae McGaha moved from the U.S. to Budapest, Hungary in 2017 to teach English to kindergarteners.

item.title: Bernie Sanders urges Dems to 'stop the bickering' and back Biden
item.description: Sen. Bernie Sanders admonished Democrats who have called for President Joe Biden to withdraw from the race against former President Donald Trump.

item.title: Startups are building balloons to hoist tourists 100,000 feet into the stratosphere
item.description: A single trip would last about 6 hours and ticket prices range from $50,000 to around $184,000 per seat.

item.title: With high prices and mortgage rates, aspiring and current homeowners feel ‘stuck'
item.description: Affordability has plummeted since the early days of the pandemic, data shows.

item.title: 'Why would you tinker with it if it's not broken?': Economist on why the Fed may not cut rates in September
item.description: There are risks to easing monetary policy that cast a cloud over the rate cut outlook, High Frequency Economics' Carl Weinberg told CNBC.

item.title: AT&T's massive data breach deepens crisis for Snowflake seven weeks after hack was disclosed
item.description: AT&T is the most high-profile company tied to Snowflake's cyberattack that the company disclosed in May.

item.title: Japan data suggests possible yen intervention of around $22 billion
item.description: Markets analysts speculated that policymakers had used the opportunity of the U.S. inflation data to enter the market.

item.title: Elon Musk's X deceives users and breaches online content rules, EU says
item.description: Elon Musk's X is in breach of EU online content rules as the social media platform uses "dark patterns" to deceive users, the European Commission said Friday.

item.title: Majority of economists say inflation would be higher under Trump than Biden: WSJ survey
item.description: President Biden has touted an optimistic inflation report that showed consumer prices declined in June for the first time in more than four years.

item.title: Alec Baldwin 'Rust' manslaughter case dismissed by judge
item.description: Alec Baldwin cannot be retried over the shooting death of "Rust" cinematographer Halyna Hutchins because ammunition evidence being hidden from his lawyers.

item.title: SpaceX’s Falcon 9 rocket suffers rare inflight failure, is grounded during investigation
item.description: A SpaceX rocket carrying Starlink satellites failed midflight, in a rare misfire for the company's workhorse Falcon 9 vehicle.

item.title: Biden stumbles over Zelenskyy introduction, calls him 'President Putin'
item.description: The latest verbal gaffe by U.S. President Joe Biden comes as he faces increasing calls by Democrats to quit the 2024 election contest against Donald Trump.

item.title: Citigroup tops expectations for profit and revenue on strong Wall Street results
item.description: Citigroup on Friday posted second-quarter results that topped expectations for profit and revenue on a rebound in Wall Street activity.

item.title: Big youth climate group calls for Biden to exit election race against Trump
item.description: President Joe Biden says he will remain in the 2024 election race against Donald Trump, but more allies are calling him to quit.
